TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit FreeformActivityDesigner extends System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.CompositeActivityDesigner

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("The System.Workflow.* types are deprecated. Instead, please use the new types from System.Activities.*")

Docs.summary: Provides a customizable activity designer surface for users to visually modify on a workflow design surface.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
> [!NOTE] > [!INCLUDE[DeprecatedContent](~/includes/deprecatedcontent-md.md)]
The <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.FreeformActivityDesigner> allows users to modify how an activity appears on a workflow design surface. When you associate <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.FreeformActivityDesigner> with a custom activity class using the `Designer` attribute, the custom activity's appearance is different from other activities when a user drops the custom activity onto a design surface. Once <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.FreeformActivityDesigner> displays an activity on the design surface, users can draw connectors to other activity designers and resize the designer within the parameters defined by the design surface.
> [!NOTE] > Users can only add connectors to the custom activity because the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.FreeformActivityDesigner> is associated with the top-level activity in a workflow.

Docs.summary: Gets an that accessibility applications use to adjust the application UI for users who have impairments.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If no `AccessibleObject` is currently assigned to the control, a new instance of one is created.
> [!NOTE] > To get or set the `AccessibilityObject` property, you must add a reference to the Accessibility assembly installed with the .NET Framework.
For more information about accessible objects, see the Active Accessibility section of the MSDN Library.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool AutoSize { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.AutoSize : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the is resized automatically when a user resizes the designer's child designers.
Docs.value: if the is resized automatically; otherwise, . The default is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks When you set <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.FreeformActivityDesigner.AutoSize%2A>, the layout of the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.FreeformActivityDesigner> is updated.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::Drawing::Size AutoSizeMargin { System::Drawing::Size get(); void set(System::Drawing::Size value); };
member this.AutoSizeMargin : System.Drawing.Size with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the margin size to render around the child designers when the is automatically resized.
Docs.value: A that represents the size of the margin to render around the child designers of the .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The default size of <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.FreeformActivityDesigner.AutoSizeMargin%2A> is a <xref:System.Drawing.Size> object with dimensions of 40 pixels by 40 pixels.
If the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.AmbientTheme.ShowGrid%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> property associated with the current workflow theme is set to `true`, <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.FreeformActivityDesigner.AutoSizeMargin%2A> settings are half the height and half the width of the grid size.
When you set <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.FreeformActivityDesigner.AutoSizeMargin%2A>, the layout of the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.FreeformActivityDesigner> is updated.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::Windows::Forms::AutoSizeMode AutoSizeMode { System::Windows::Forms::AutoSizeMode get(); void set(System::Windows::Forms::AutoSizeMode value); };
member this.AutoSizeMode : System.Windows.Forms.AutoSizeMode with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the settings for the .
Docs.value: The for the . The default setting is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The default behavior of <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.FreeformActivityDesigner.AutoSizeMode%2A> allows the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.FreeformActivityDesigner> to grow as necessary to fit its contents but does not shrink smaller than the value of the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.FreeformActivityDesigner.MinimumSize%2A> property.
When you set <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.FreeformActivityDesigner.AutoSizeMode%2A>, the layout of the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.FreeformActivityDesigner> is updated.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void BringToFront(class System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner containedDesigner) cil managed

Docs.param: The to bring to the top of the z-order.
Docs.summary: Brings the specified to the top of the z-order of the .

remarks.format:
## Remarks <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.FreeformActivityDesigner.BringToFront%2A> modifies the z-order for the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.FreeformActivityDesigner> to display the specified <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner> as its top visible child designer. You can use this method to display a designer at the top of the z-order when a user selects it.
`containedDesigner` must be in a child of the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.FreeformActivityDesigner> before you call <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.FreeformActivityDesigner.BringToFront%2A>. If it is not, <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.FreeformActivityDesigner.BringToFront%2A> throws an <xref:System.ArgumentException>.

remarks.format: ## Remarks <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.FreeformActivityDesigner.HitTest%2A> checks whether the location has occurred on a connector or one of the child activity designers. If the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.FreeformActivityDesigner.HitTest%2A> occurs on a child activity that is being dragged to another location, <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.FreeformActivityDesigner.HitTest%2A> returns information about the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.FreeformActivityDesigner>, not the designer being moved.

remarks.format:
## Remarks <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.FreeformActivityDesigner.MoveContainedDesigner%2A> sets new bounds for the moved designer and performs all required layout operations for the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.FreeformActivityDesigner> on the workflow design surface.
`containedDesigner` must be in a child of the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.FreeformActivityDesigner> before you call <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.FreeformActivityDesigner.MoveContainedDesigner%2A>. If it is not, <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.FreeformActivityDesigner.MoveContainedDesigner%2A> throws an <xref:System.ArgumentException>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance valuetype System.Drawing.Size OnLayoutSize(class System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesignerLayoutEventArgs e) cil managed
Protected Overrides Function OnLayoutSize (e As ActivityDesignerLayoutEventArgs) As Size

Docs.param: The that defines the operation event arguments.
Docs.summary: Notifies the when the size of the visual cues on the designers displayed by the have changed.
Docs.returns: The that represents the new size of the on the workflow design surface.

remarks.format: ## Remarks <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.FreeformActivityDesigner.OnLayoutSize%2A> returns the size of the current bounding rectangle for the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.FreeformActivityDesigner> when <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.FreeformActivityDesigner.AutoSize%2A> is set to `false`. If <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.FreeformActivityDesigner.AutoSize%2A> is set to `true` and <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.FreeformActivityDesigner.AutoSizeMode%2A> is set to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.AutoSizeMode.GrowOnly?displayProperty=nameWithType>, <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.FreeformActivityDesigner.OnLayoutSize%2A> calculates and returns new size settings for the bounding rectangle. If <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.FreeformActivityDesigner.AutoSize%2A> is set to true and <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.FreeformActivityDesigner.AutoSizeMode%2A> is not set to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.AutoSizeMode.GrowAndShrink?displayProperty=nameWithType>, <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.FreeformActivityDesigner.OnLayoutSize%2A> returns <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.FreeformActivityDesigner.MinimumSize%2A>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance void OnResizing(class System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesignerResizeEventArgs e) cil managed
Protected Overrides Sub OnResizing (e As ActivityDesignerResizeEventArgs)

Docs.param: The that defines the operation event arguments.
Docs.summary: Notifies the when a user is visually resizing it at design time.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.FreeformActivityDesigner.AutoSize%2A> is set to `true` and <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.FreeformActivityDesigner.AutoSizeMode%2A> is set to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.AutoSizeMode.GrowOnly?displayProperty=nameWithType>, <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.FreeformActivityDesigner.OnResizing%2A> performs all resizing tasks on the workflow design surface. If <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.FreeformActivityDesigner.AutoSize%2A> is set to `true` and <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.FreeformActivityDesigner.AutoSizeMode%2A> is set to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.AutoSizeMode.GrowAndShrink?displayProperty=nameWithType>, <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.FreeformActivityDesigner.OnResizing%2A> performs layout tasks, but no resizing tasks. If <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.FreeformActivityDesigner.AutoSize%2A> is set to `false`, all contained designers retain their previous locations on the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.FreeformActivityDesigner>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance void OnThemeChange(class System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesignerTheme newTheme) cil managed
Protected Overrides Sub OnThemeChange (newTheme As ActivityDesignerTheme)

Docs.param: The that contains the updated theme property settings.
Docs.summary: Notifies the that its associated theme has changed.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Unless overridden in a derived class, <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.FreeformActivityDesigner.OnThemeChange%2A> always sets the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner.Text%2A> property to an empty string and the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner.Image%2A> property to `null` (`Nothing` in Visual Basic).
If <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.AmbientTheme.ShowGrid%2A> is set to `true`, the locations of each child designer in the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.FreeformActivityDesigner> is snapped to the nearest grid line.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void RemoveConnector(class System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.Connector connector) cil managed

Docs.param: The to remove.
Docs.summary: Removes the specified from the .

remarks.format: ## Remarks <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.FreeformActivityDesigner.RemoveConnector%2A> deletes the specified connector from the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.FreeformActivityDesigner.Connectors%2A> collection and calls the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.FreeformActivityDesigner.OnConnectorRemoved%2A> method.

Docs.exception: contains a reference ( in Visual Basic).

MemberSignature.Value: public void ResizeContainedDesigner (System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner containedDesigner, System.Drawing.Size newSize);
.method public hidebysig instance void ResizeContainedDesigner(class System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner containedDesigner, valuetype System.Drawing.Size newSize) cil managed
Public Sub ResizeContainedDesigner (containedDesigner As ActivityDesigner, newSize As Size)

Docs.param: The to resize.
The that represents the new dimensions of the designer.
Docs.summary: Resizes the specified to the dimensions of specified size.

remarks.format:
## Remarks <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.FreeformActivityDesigner.ResizeContainedDesigner%2A> sets new bounds for the resized designer and performs all required layout operations for the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.FreeformActivityDesigner> on the workflow design surface.
`containedDesigner` must be in a child of the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.FreeformActivityDesigner> before you call <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.FreeformActivityDesigner.ResizeContainedDesigner%2A>. If it is not, <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.FreeformActivityDesigner.ResizeContainedDesigner%2A> throws an <xref:System.ArgumentException>.

Docs.exception: contains a reference ( in Visual Basic).
is not found in the collection.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void SendToBack(class System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner containedDesigner) cil managed

Docs.param: The to set to the back of the z-order.
Docs.summary: Sets the specified to the bottom of the z-order of the .

remarks.format:
## Remarks <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.FreeformActivityDesigner.SendToBack%2A> modifies the z-order for the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.FreeformActivityDesigner> to display the specified <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner> as the bottom visible designer on the design surface. You can use this method to display a designer at the bottom of the z-order when a user deselects it.
`containedDesigner` must be in a child of the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.FreeformActivityDesigner> before you call <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.FreeformActivityDesigner.SendToBack%2A>. If it is not, <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.FreeformActivityDesigner.SendToBack%2A> throws an <xref:System.ArgumentException>.

Docs.exception: contains a reference ( in Visual Basic).
is not found in the collection.

MemberSignature.Value: Protected Overridable ReadOnly Property ShowConnectorsInForeground As Boolean
protected: virtual property bool ShowConnectorsInForeground { bool get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the draws connectors in the foreground of its design surface.
Docs.value: if the draws connectors in the foreground of its design surface; otherwise, . The default is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks Unless overridden in a class that derives from <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.FreeformActivityDesigner>, <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.FreeformActivityDesigner.ShowConnectorsInForeground%2A> always returns `false`.
